subject: physics
topic: Why Doesn't the Moon Fall Down?
hook: Moon Earth की तरफ FALL कर रहा है... हर SECOND! लेकिन गिरता क्यों नहीं?
key_points: Moon IS falling - at 1.4mm per second towards Earth!
But Earth's surface curves AWAY as Moon falls
It's like throwing a ball SO HARD it keeps missing the ground
Orbital velocity = falling + moving sideways perfectly balanced
Newton imagined a cannon on a mountain - same concept!
core_analogy: Imagine throwing a ball. Throw harder = falls farther. Throw INFINITELY hard = it keeps falling but never lands because Earth curves away!
mind_blow: ISS astronauts are NOT weightless - they're falling at 28,000 km/h but missing Earth every time!
exam_relevance: JEE: Orbital velocity v = sqrt(GM/r). NEET: Weightlessness in satellites.
